seg.seg: On the 20th day of the 4th (month), I bought fragrance for 3 (coins) ... ///
For the full moon of the 11th (month, I bought) fragrance ... [Laraiyśe] has seen.
On the 21st day of the 9th (month), [I gave] ... (to the) [musicians] ... [50] (coins).
[On the 13th day] of the 12th (month), I gave coins to Indrawarme: [3].
For the Full moon (= the 15th day) in the 5th (month), I bought fragrance .... [Kercapiśke has seen].
On the 9th day of the 6th month, (I bought) keklyenta ... [Jñānasene has seen].
On the 11th day, Kercapiśke (left in order to) [mill] wheat. (For paying the fee, I gave him the coins of the stūpa/Buddha: 25.
On the 21st day, (Kercapiśke) left in order to mill (wheat). I gave him stūpas' coins: 2[7].
(On the 6th day of the 7th month), [I bought] (fragrance) for 2 (coins).
For pravarik*, (I bought oil/ghee) for the lamp to the Buddhas: (two) pints, for 12 (coins).
On the [23rd] day of the 8th (month, I bought fragrance) for (five coins). Kercapiśke has seen.
On the 13th day of the 10th (month, I bought) fragrance for [3] coins. Sutane has seen.

par le vœu pour la dignité de Buddha (je prends refuge en Bud)dha, je prends refuge en la (L)oi, je prends refuge en la communauté. Une deuxième fois m(oi) je prends (refuge en Buddha), je prends refuge en la Loi, je prends (refuge) en la communauté. (Une troisième foi m)oi, de tel nom, ayant pris refuge en Buddha, ayant pris refuge en la Loi, (ayant pris refuge en la communauté) ...

[[Adams 2016a]]: 2-3 transcribes and translates:

b1. paññiktiññe perneṣṣe akāl‹k›sa : pa(ñ)i(kte saim yamaskemar p)elaikne saim
= "with the wish of [attaining] Buddha-worth I make the Buddha [my] refuge; the law [my] refuge"

b2. yamaskemar sā‹ṅ›k saim yamaskemar wate ñi(ś pañikte saim ya)maskemar
= "I make; I make the community [my] refuge a second [time]; I make the Buddha [my] refuge"

b3. pelaikne saim yamaskemar sāṅk saim yama(skemar tritesa ñ)iś te-ñemtsa
= "I make the law [my] refuge; I make the community [my] refuge for a third [time]; I, named so-and-so"

b4. paṃñikte saim yāmu pelaikne saim yāmu (sāṅk saim yāmu kom lyu)śsi yaṣṣi a-
= "having taken the Buddha [as] refuge, having taken the law [as] refuge, having taken the community [as] refuge in daylight [and] at night"

b5. -rkañ lukatsi tä‹ṅ›ktsi oktacce klyommoṃ papā(ṣṣorñe aṣanikeṃts y)aitkor wärpa-
= " as obliged, until dawn, I undertake to observe the noble eightfold morality, the commandment of the arhats"

b6. -namar pāsi astare paskemar
= "I (will) observe [it] in all its purity". (TI)
